data.text:
Isaac Bashevis Singer

Franklin Center, Pennsylvania: Franklin Library, 1988. First Edition. Full Leather. New / No Jacket as Issued. Item #1722

A handsome dark orange leather Limited First Edition signed by Nobel Prize-winning author, Isaac Bashevis Singer. In fine unread condition in the original shrinkwrap with the descripton card enclosed on the front side. With gold-gilt cover designs and page edges, and bound-in silk bookmark. By the author of "The Family Moskat," "The Manor," "The Estate," "The King of the Fields," "The Certificate," "A Day of Pleasure," and "Yentl the Yeshiva Boy." Isaac Bashevis Singer won the Nobel Prize for Literature for 1978. He died in 1991. A beautiful copy.
